com.pb.sawdust.util

Class MonteCarlo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.MonteCarlo

  • public class MonteCarlo
extends java.lang.Object
    The MonteCarlo class provides the basic functionality for doing Monte Carlo choice analysis. Given a distribution, it will provide random choices from that distribution based on a random number generator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(double[] distribution,
          java.util.Random random)
        Constructor specifying the distribution and random number generator. The distribution need only be relative (that is, it does not need to sum to one), though its contents must all be non-negative and must sum to a non-zero value.
        Parameters:
        distribution - A list of values specifying the relative distribution.
        random - The random number generator to use when performing draws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any value in distribution is less than zero, or if all values in distribution are equal to zero.

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(double[] distribution,
          long randomSeed)
        Constructor specifying the distribution and random number generator seed. The distribution need only be relative (that is, it does not need to sum to one), though its contents must all be non-negative and must sum to a non-zero value.
        Parameters:
        distribution - A list of values specifying the relative distribution.
        randomSeed - The seed to use for the random number generator used when performing draws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any value in distribution is less than zero, or if all values in distribution are equal to zero.

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(double[] distribution)
        Constructor specifying the distribution. The distribution need only be relative (that is, it does not need to sum to one), though its contents must all be non-negative and must sum to a non-zero value. A default random number generator will be used for draws.
        Parameters:
        distribution - A list of values specifying the relative distribution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any value in distribution is less than zero, or if all values in distribution are equal to zero.

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(int length,
          java.util.Random random)
        Constructor specifying a uniform distribution with a specified length and random number generator.
        Parameters:
        length - The number of elements in the distribution.
        random - The random number generator to use when performing draws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if length is less than zero.

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(int length,
          int randomSeed)
        Constructor specifying a uniform distribution with a specified length and a random number generator seed.
        Parameters:
        length - The number of elements in the distribution.
        randomSeed - The seed to use for the random number generator used when performing draws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if length is less than zero.

      • MonteCarlo

        public MonteCarlo(int length)
        Constructor specifying a uniform distribution with a specified length. A default random number generator will be
        Parameters:
        length - The number of elements in the distribution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if length is less than zero.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistributionSize

        public int getDistributionSize()
        Get the number of elements (choices) in this instance's distribution.
        Returns:
        the length of this instance's distribution.

      • getNormalizedDistribution

        public double[] getNormalizedDistribution()
        Get the normalized distribution for this instance. The value in each cell is the proportion that the cell's index will be returned from a call to draw() if an infinite number of draws were performed.
        Returns:
        this instance's normalized distribution.

      • draw

        public int draw()
        Make a random draw. The returned value will be between 0 (inclusive) and getDistributionSize() (exclusive), and will be based on the distribution specified when construction this instance.
        Returns:
        a Monte Carlo choice from this instance's distribution.

      • drawWithoutReplacement

        public int drawWithoutReplacement(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> usedChoices)
        Make a draw excluding a set of choices. This can be used to create drawing "without replacement" behavior by feeding to this method those choices which have already been drawn.
        Parameters:
        usedChoices - The choices which have already been used.
        Returns:
        a Monte Carlo choice from this instance's distribution, excluding usedChoices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if all of the choices in this instance are contained in usedChoices, or if any of the choices in usedChoices is not a valid choice for this Monte Carlo instance.

      • removeChoice

        public MonteCarlo removeChoice(int choice)
        Get a MonteCarlo instance equivalent to this instance with a specified choice removed.
        Parameters:
        choice - The choice to remove.
        Returns:
        a new MonteCarlo with choice removed. Note that the returned instance will have a distribution length equal to this one, only with the removed choice's probability set to 0.0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if choice is not a choice in this instance.

      • removeChoices

        public MonteCarlo removeChoices(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> choices)
        Get a MonteCarlo instance equivalent to this instance with a set of specified choices removed.
        Parameters:
        choices - The choices to remove.
        Returns:
        a new MonteCarlo with choices removed. Note that the returned instance will have a distribution length equal to this one, only with the removed choices's probabilities set to 0.0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any choice in choices is not a choice in this instance.

      • chooseMonteCarlo

        public static <T> java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer> chooseMonteCarlo(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> distribution,
                                                      int numberOfDraws,
                                                      java.util.Random random)
        Convenience method to create a randomized selection (with replacement) of objects from a distribution.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the objects for which the sample is being built.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The basis distribution. The keys are the choices, and the values are their relative weights.
        numberOfDraws - Number of draws to perform. The sum of the returned values will equal this number.
        random - The random number generator to use to perform the draws.
        Returns:
        a mapping from each object (key) in distribution to the number of times it was placed in the random sample.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any value in distribution is less than zero, or if all values in distribution are equal to zero.

      • chooseMonteCarlo

        public static <T> java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer> chooseMonteCarlo(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> distribution,
                                                      int numberOfDraws)
        Convenience method to create a randomized selection (with replacement) of objects from a distribution. A default random-number generator will be used to build the sample.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the objects for which the sample is being built.
        Parameters:
        distribution - The basis distribution. The keys are the choices, and the values are their relative weights.
        numberOfDraws - Number of draws to perform. The sum of the returned values will equal this number.
        Returns:
        a mapping from each object (key) in distribution to the number of times it was placed in the random sample.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any value in distribution is less than zero, or if all values in distribution are equal to zero.
